p: Most of the surveyed forest products, such as firewood, charcoal, mushrooms, medicinal plants, thatch grass and wild fruits or vegetables, were observed to have no significant association with increased incidence of flooding ( p > 0.05). Timber or construction was the only product observed to have significant association with flooding event ( p < 0.05). Increased incidence of flooding is shown to reduce the likelihood that the people will report scarcity of timber or construction wood by 27%. This may imply that the people do not perceive flooding to be a risk to the availability of timber. In general, flooding event was not perceived to be a risk to any of the forest products used for livelihood in the study communities.
